awards.description: THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF EYAK WILL CONTINUE TO BUILD THEIR ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM TO ADDRESS TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES THROUGH INCREASING ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY THROUGH THE FOLLOWINGAND RESPONDING TO TRIBAL MEMBERS ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNSAND FULFILLING ALL GRANT ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAMMATIC REQUIREMENTSAND PARTICIPATING IN REGIONAL ENVIRONMENTAL TRAININGAND CONTINUED DEVELOPMENT OF GIS PROGRAMAND GATHERING BASELINE DATA ON EROSION AND WATER QUALITYAND ORGANIZING YOUTH ENVIRONMENTAL ACTIVITIESAND PARTICIPATION IN LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL WORKING GROUPSAND COLLABORATION WITH CORDOVA CITY GOVT ON SOLID WASTE ISSUES, INCLUDING MARINE DEBRIS.

DESCRIPTION:THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF EYAK WILL USE GENERAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (GAP) FUNDING TO ADDRESS PRIORITY ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS IN THE COMMUNITY. ENVIRONMENTAL STAFF WILL FOCUS ON TECHNICAL TRAINING AND BUILDING MANAGEMENT CAPACITY, WITH THE GOAL OF ACHIEVING PROGRAMMATIC GROWTH TO MAINTAIN MEANINGFUL PARTICIPATION IN EPA PROGRAMS. KEY AREAS OF FOCUS INCLUDE ESTABLISHING PUBLIC PARTICIPATION AND EDUCATION, EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS, WATER QUALITY MONITORING, AND ADDRESSING SOLID WASTE MANAGEMENT ISSUES.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES PERFORMED UNDER THE GRANT WILL FOCUS ON TECHNICAL TRAINING TO BUILD ADMINISTRATIVE AND ENVIRONMENTAL SKILLS RELEVANT TO THE TRIBE'S PRIORITIES. A KEY ELEMENT OF THIS PROGRAM INVOLVES BUILDING A PATH TOWARDS INCREASED COLLABORATION WITH MULTIPLE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAMS AND AGENCIES, ULTIMATELY ENHANCING MEANINGFUL PARTICIPATION IN EPA PROGRAMS. FINALLY, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION WILL BE INSTRUMENTAL TO ACHIEVING ENVIRONMENTAL RESULTS, INCLUDING SOLID WASTE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES FROM NATIVE VILLAGE OF EYAK WILL INCLUDE SEMIANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS TO EPA, OUTLINING PROGRESS TOWARDS ENVIRONMENTAL RESULTS IN PRIORITY AREAS. IN ADDITION, TRIP REPORTS WILL OUTLINE TECHNICAL CAPACITIES GAINED FROM ATTENDING RELEVANT TRAININGS AND CONFERENCES. ALSO, THE NATIVE VILLAGE OF EYAK WITH DEVELOP QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS. FINALLY, PHOTOS OF ENVIRONMENTAL CLEAN-UPS, COMMUNITY TRAININGS AND EVENTS WILL DEMONSTRATE THE ACCOMPLISHMENTS RESULTING FROM THESE WORK PLAN COMMITMENTS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT ARE MEMBERS OF THE TRIBE.
NSFLTP GRANT FUNDS TO AUTHORIZE PRE-AWARD COSTS UNDER A PLANNED GRANT AGREEMENT WITH NATIVE VILLAGE OF EYAK.
